BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Isolated glide-snow avalanches, shallow-snowdrift problem at high altitude
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. There is a latent gliding snow problem in all aspects at high altitudes. In high starting zones where there is a lot of snow, avalanches can reach medium sized in isolated cases. Above 2200 m, small snowdrift accumlations are prone to triggering. Danger of falling outweighs that of snow masses.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is compact and widespread moist-to-wet at least superficially, during the nocturnal hours above 2200 m a melt-freeze crust capable of bearing loads forms, beneath it on shady slopes are breakable crusts. Firn snow can form during the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Skies will clear during the night, mostly scattered clouds or cloudless. More clouds will move in during early morning. Winds will slacken off (moderate-to-strong). At 2000 m: 0 degrees; at 3000 m: -7 degrees. Wednesday will be cloudy. In morning the peaks will be in the clear, later on shrouded. Winds will be mostly light to moderate, mostly from the SW. At 2000 m: 1 degree. On Wednesday night, heavily overcast skies, minor precipitation is possible.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As temperatures rise the wet-snow and gliding snow problems will intensify slightly

AvProblem.comment: isolated, in steep grass-covered terrain which has not yet discharged

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Isolated glide-snow avalanches. Minor snowdrift problem at high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Glide-snow avalanches can release in all aspects and altitudes, reach medium size. Above 2200 m, small snowdrift accumlations are prone to triggering. Danger of falling outweighs that of snow masses.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Fresh snowdrifts abobve 2400 m are trigger-prone, lie deposited atop soft layers. During the night a melt-freeze crust forms which is capable of bearing loads, below it are breakable crusts. Firn snow can form during the daytime.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Skies will clear during the night, mostly scattered clouds or cloudless. More clouds will move in during early morning. Winds will slacken off (moderate-to-strong). At 2000 m: 0 degrees; at 3000 m: -7 degrees. Wednesday will be cloudy. In morning the peaks will be in the clear, later on shrouded. Winds will be mostly light to moderate, mostly from the SW. At 2000 m: 1 degree. On Wednesday night, heavily overcast skies, minor precipitation is possible.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As temperatures rise the wet-snow and gliding snow problems will intensify slightly

AvProblem.comment: near ridges, small, above 2200 m, behind discontinuities
isolated, in steep grass-covered terrain which has not yet discharged

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Up above: fresh snowdrifts. Down below: gliding snow.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2400 m is MODERATE, below that altitude danger is low. Small-to-medium slabs can be triggered by 1 person on some slopes, esp. NW/N/E facing, above 2400 m. Danger zones increase with ascending altitude. Below 2600 m there is latent danger of glide-snow avalanches, in isolated starting zones they can grow large.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Fresh snowdrifts above 2400 m are trigger-prone, lie deposited atop soft layers. During the night a melt-freeze crust forms which is capable of bearing loads, below it are breakable crusts. Firn snow can form during the daytime.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Skies will clear during the night, mostly scattered clouds or cloudless. More clouds will move in during early morning. Winds will slacken off (moderate-to-strong). At 2000 m: 0 degrees; at 3000 m: -7 degrees. Wednesday will be cloudy. In morning the peaks will be in the clear, later on shrouded. Winds will be mostly light to moderate, mostly from the SW. At 2000 m: 1 degree. On Wednesday night, heavily overcast skies, minor precipitation is possible.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As temperatures rise the wet-snow and gliding snow problems will intensify.
